column4: Birds worth less than 4 points

Birds that eat [seed]

column4: Birds that have at least 4 eggs laid on them

column6: Terms include America, Asia, Atlantic, Australasia, Australia, Baltimore, California, Canada, Carolina, Chihuahua, Corsica, desert, East, Eurasia, Europe, forest, Himalaya, Inca, India, island, jungle, mallee, marsh, Mississippi, moor, mountain, New Holland, North, Orient, Pacific, Philippine, plains, prairie, sandhill, Savannah, scrub, sea, South, Sri Lanka, West

column4: Birds in your habitat with the fewest birds.
column6: Ties count: If you have 3 birds in each habitat, your habitat with the fewest birds has 3 birds.

column4: Birds with [ground] nests
column6: Birds must have a [ground] or [star] nest symbol.

column4: Birds that eat only [invertebrate]

column4: Consecutive birds in [forest] with ascending or descending wingspans

column4: Sets of the 4 nest types / 1 set = [bowl] [cavity] [ground] [platform]
column6: Each star nest can be treated as any 1 nest type. No card can be part of more than 1 set.

column4: Columns with a matching pair or trio of nests
column5: 2 of the same nest in a column: 1; 3 of the same nest in a column: 3
column6: Different columns may (but need not) score using different nest types. Star nests are wild, but each counts only once.

column5: 3 consecutive birds: 3; 4 consecutive birds: 5; 5 consecutive birds: 8

column6: Birds with no egg capacity do not count toward this card.

column6: You may count each [star] nest as any other type or as a fifth type.
